text: A sulfite is an ion that is made of one sulfur atom and three oxygen atoms. Its chemical formula is . Sulfite is made when sulfurous acid (a solution of sulfur dioxide in water) or bisulfite is deprotonated. Salts containing the sulfite ion are called sulfites. Sodium sulfite is an example. Sulfites are weak reducing agents; they can be oxidized to sulfates. They are used to preserve dried food. Some people have allergies to sulfite in food, and it makes them sick. It contains sulfur in the +4 oxidation state. ==Related pages== *Sulfate *Sulfur Category:Oxyanions Category:Sulfur compounds
